1.text: Get the game board and 64 black and white discs.

2.text: Place 2 black and 2 white discs at the center of the board.

3.text: Set up the board to give the inexperienced player the advantage.

4.text: Allow the less experienced player to go first.

5.text: Place the first disc in a spot that surrounds an opponent’s disc.

6.text: Flip the outflanked disc to its opposite side.

7.text: Pass the turn to your opponent to continue playing.

8.text: Continue taking turns placing discs until a legal move isn’t possible.

9.text: Try to establish stable disc positions.

10.text: Give your opponent a disc to play if they run out.

11.text: Wait to make moves that your opponent cannot take.

12.text: Limit the number of discs you flip over early in the game.

13.text: Avoid boxing yourself in or limiting your mobility.

14.text: Count the number of discs of each color to determine a winner.

15.text: Set a time limit for a more intense game.
